revised_title: Methods for Continuous and Quasi-Continuous Registration of Diurnal Body Temperature
tldr: The author discusses methods for continuous and quasi-continuous registration of the diurnal curve of the human body temperature. He advocates for a thermo-electric method using galvanometers and photographic recorders, and describes the improvements in apparatus that have facilitated these investigations. The author also presents the "thread recorder" of Horace Darwin for quasi-continuous registration in clinical settings.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Medical Thermometry
